title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady nearly joined the Las Vegas Raiders as a quarterback in 2020, Raiders owner Mark Davis confirmed.
Brady became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023, three months after ending his NFL career.
The NFL adjusted its rules in 2025, allowing Brady, a FOX commentator, to attend production meetings but not practice facilities.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is streaming on HBO Max.
'Highest 2 Lowest' featuring Denzel Washington is a Spike Lee remake available on Apple TV+.
'The Paper,' a spinoff of 'The Office,' is streaming on Peacock.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers returns to Foxborough with the Raiders to face the Patriots in the season opener.
Former Patriots coach Pete Carroll discusses New England's physical running game and strong defensive front.
Raiders' offensive coordinator Chip Kelly highlights Patriots' formidable front seven, noting new defensive starters.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics' Jaylen Brown and YouTuber IShowSpeed live streamed from Boston, reenacting the Boston Tea Party in a humorous fashion.
The duo participated in Muay Thai and a foot race, with IShowSpeed narrowly defeating Brown despite claiming a hamstring injury.
Brown humorously contested IShowSpeed's race victory on social media, continuing his series of offseason streaming activities.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell to make NFL debut as Patriots' starting left tackle against Raiders on Sunday.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's dynamic run blocking and competitive nature despite arm length concerns.
Campbell earned high preseason grades, but Scarnecchia expects challenges in protecting against Raiders' Maxx Crosby.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel responded to a ban preventing Patriots scouts from UNC practices and games, implemented by Bill Belichick.
Bill Belichick barred New England scouts following a strained relationship with Patriots owner Robert Kraft after his firing.
Patriots scouts can access UNC player information via film requests and phone inquiries but cannot attend events in person.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A University of Rhode Island student is suing the school after allegedly being filmed in a unisex shower on campus.
The lawsuit accuses URI of negligence and defamation for failing to provide adequate security and misleading public statements.
James Paquette, identified by the student, faces a charge of video voyeurism in the alleged incident.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss the Patriots' season opener against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel listed rookie left tackle Will Campbell as questionable with an ankle injury.
The Raiders will face a revamped Patriots secondary, with new arrivals and recent roster changes for the Patriots.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is progressing well in his recovery from an Achilles tear, according to teammate Jordan Walsh.
The Celtics have not set a timeline for Tatum's return after his injury in the May 2025 Eastern Conference Semifinals.
Tatum is walking without a boot, but the team remains cautious about rushing his return for the 2025-26 season.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Raiders start a new era with Pete Carroll as head coach and Geno Smith as quarterback.
Tight end Brock Bowers set records last season and leads projections for tight ends in 2025.
The Raiders selected Ashton Jeanty sixth overall; he's favored to win Offensive Rookie of the Year.
